text.description: Use for primary text, such as body copy, sentence case headers, and buttons.

red.description: Use for red text on non-bold backgrounds when there is no meaning tied to the color, such as colored tags.

bolder.description: Use on bold red accent backgrounds.

orange.description: Use for orange text on non-bold backgrounds when there is no meaning tied to the color, such as colored tags.

bolder.description: Use on bold orange accent backgrounds.

yellow.description: Use for yellow text on non-bold backgrounds when there is no meaning tied to the color, such as colored tags.

bolder.description: Use on bold yellow accent backgrounds.

lime.description: Use for lime text on subtlest and subtler lime accent backgrounds when there is no meaning tied to the color.

bolder.description: Use for lime text on subtle lime accent backgrounds when there is no meaning tied to the color.

green.description: Use for green text on non-bold backgrounds when there is no meaning tied to the color, such as colored tags.

bolder.description: Use on bold green accent backgrounds.

teal.description: Use for teal text on non-bold backgrounds when there is no meaning tied to the color, such as colored tags.

bolder.description: Use on bold teal accent backgrounds.

blue.description: Use for blue text on non-bold backgrounds when there is no meaning tied to the color, such as colored tags.

bolder.description: Use on bold blue accent backgrounds.

purple.description: Use for purple text on non-bold backgrounds when there is no meaning tied to the color, such as colored tags.

bolder.description: Use on bold purple accent backgrounds.

magenta.description: Use for magenta text on non-bold backgrounds when there is no meaning tied to the color, such as colored tags.

bolder.description: Use on bold magenta accent backgrounds.

gray.description: Use for text on non-bold gray accent backgrounds, such as colored tags.

bolder.description: Use for text and icons on gray subtle accent backgrounds.

disabled.description: Use for text in a disabled state.

inverse.description: Use for text on bold backgrounds.

selected.description: Use for text in selected or opened states, such as tabs and dropdown buttons.

brand.description: Use for text that reinforces our brand.

danger.description: Use for critical text, such as input field error messaging.

warning.description: Use for text to emphasize caution, such as in moved lozenges.

inverse.description: Use for text when on bold warning backgrounds.

success.description: Use for text to communicate a favorable outcome, such as input field success messaging.

discovery.description: Use for text to emphasize change or something new, such as in new lozenges.

information.description: Use for informative text or to communicate something is in progress, such as in-progress lozenges.

subtlest.description: Use for tertiary text, such as meta-data, breadcrumbs, input field placeholder and helper text.

subtle.description: Use for secondary text, such as navigation, subtle button links, input field labels, and all caps subheadings.

icon.description: Use for icon-only buttons, or icons paired with color.text

disabled.description: Use for backgrounds of elements in a disabled state.

input.description: Use for background of form UI elements, such as text fields, checkboxes, and radio buttons.

subtle.description: Use for backgrounds of elements on a bold background, such as in the buttons on spotlight cards.

hovered.description: Use for the hovered state of color.background.inverse.subtle

pressed.description: Use for the pressed state of color.background.inverse.subtle

neutral.description: The default background for neutral elements, such as default buttons.

subtle.description: Use for the background of elements that appear to have no background in a resting state, such as subtle buttons and menu items.

bold.description: A vibrant background option for neutral UI elements, such as announcement banners.

selected.description: Use for the background of elements in a selected state, such as in opened dropdown buttons.

bold.description: Use for the backgrounds of elements in a selected state, such as checkboxes and radio buttons.

subtlest.description: Use for the background of elements used to reinforce our brand, but with less emphasis.

bold.description: Use for the background of elements used to reinforce our brand, but with more emphasis.

boldest.description: Use for the background of elements used to reinforce our brand that needs to stand out a lot.

danger.description: Use for backgrounds communicating critical information, such in error section messages.

bold.description: A vibrant background option for communicating critical information, such as in danger buttons and error banners.

warning.description: Use for backgrounds communicating caution, such as in warning section messages.

bold.description: A vibrant background option for communicating caution, such as in warning buttons and warning banners.

success.description: Use for backgrounds communicating a favorable outcome, such as in success section messages.

bold.description: A vibrant background option for communicating a favorable outcome, such as in checked toggles.

discovery.description: Use for backgrounds communicating change or something new, such as in discovery section messages.

bold.description: A vibrant background option communicating change or something new, such as in onboarding spotlights.

information.description: Use for backgrounds communicating information or something in-progress, such as in information section messages.

bold.description: A vibrant background option for communicating information or something in-progress.

blanket.description: Use for the screen overlay that appears with modal dialogs

selected.description: Use as an overlay to communicate selected states when a simple background color change isn't possible, such as in Editor block elements

danger.description: Use as an overlay to communicate danger states when a simple background color change isn't possible, such as deletion of Editor block elements

hovered.description: Use as a background overlay for elements in a hovered state when their background color cannot change, such as avatars.

pressed.description: Use as a background overlay for elements in a pressed state when their background color cannot change, such as avatars.

subtle.description: Use for the pulse or shimmer effect in skeleton loading states

brand.description: Our primary color for data visualisation. Use when only one color is required.

danger.description: For data visualisation communicating negative information, such as 'off track'.

bold.description: A stronger emphasis option of color.chart.danger.

warning.description: For data visualisation communicating caution, such as 'at risk' statuses.

bold.description: A stronger emphasis option of color.chart.warning.

success.description: For data visualisation communicating positive information, such as 'on track'.

bold.description: A stronger emphasis option of color.chart.success.

information.description: For data visualisation communicating low priority or in-progress statuses.

bold.description: A stronger emphasis option of color.chart.information.

link.description: Use for links in a default or hovered state. Add an underline for hovered states.

pressed.description: Use for links in a pressed state.

surface.description: Use as the primary background for the UI.

overlay.description: Use for the background of elements that sit on top of they UI, such as modals, dialogs, dropdown menus, floating toolbars, and floating single-action buttons. Also use for the background of raised cards in a dragged state. Combine with elevation.shadow.overlay.

raised.description: Use for the background of cards that can be moved, such as Jira cards on a Kanban board. Combine with elevation.shadow.raised.

sunken.description: A secondary background for the UI commonly used for grouping items, such as Jira cards in columns.

perimeter.description: Use only when elevation.shadow.overflow is not technically feasible to implement. Pair with elevation.shadow.overflow.spread to replicate the overflow shadow.

spread.description: Use only when elevation.shadow.overflow is not technically feasible to implement. Pair with elevation.shadow.overflow.perimeter to replicate the overflow shadow.

1.description: For data visualisation only. Follow numbered sequence.

2.description: For data visualisation only. Follow numbered sequence.

3.description: For data visualisation only. Follow numbered sequence.

4.description: For data visualisation only. Follow numbered sequence.

5.description: For data visualisation only. Follow numbered sequence.

6.description: For data visualisation only. Follow numbered sequence.

7.description: For data visualisation only. Follow numbered sequence.

8.description: For data visualisation only. Follow numbered sequence.

neutral.description: A secondary color for data visualisation or to communicate 'to-do' statues.

bold.description: For data visualisation only.

bolder.description: For data visualisation only.

bold.description: For data visualisation only.

bolder.description: For data visualisation only.

bold.description: For data visualisation only.

bolder.description: For data visualisation only.

bold.description: For data visualisation only.

bolder.description: For data visualisation only.

bold.description: For data visualisation only.

bolder.description: For data visualisation only.

bold.description: For data visualisation only.

bolder.description: For data visualisation only.

bold.description: For data visualisation only.

bolder.description: For data visualisation only.

bold.description: For data visualisation only.

bolder.description: For data visualisation only.

bold.description: For data visualisation only.

bolder.description: For data visualisation only.

bold.description: For data visualisation only.

bolder.description: For data visualisation only.

brand.description: Our primary color for data visualisation. Use when only one color is required.

danger.description: For data visualisation communicating negative information, such as 'off track'.

bold.description: A stronger emphasis option of color.chart.danger.

warning.description: For data visualisation communicating caution, such as 'at risk' statuses.

bold.description: A stronger emphasis option of color.chart.warning.

success.description: For data visualisation communicating positive information, such as 'on track'.

bold.description: A stronger emphasis option of color.chart.success.

information.description: For data visualisation communicating low priority or in-progress statuses.

bold.description: A stronger emphasis option of color.chart.information.

link.description: Use for links in a default or hovered state. Add an underline for hovered states.

pressed.description: Use for links in a pressed state.

surface.description: Use as the primary background for the UI.

overlay.description: Use for the background of elements that sit on top of they UI, such as modals, dialogs, dropdown menus, floating toolbars, and floating single-action buttons. Also use for the background of raised cards in a dragged state. Combine with elevation.shadow.overlay.

raised.description: Use for the background of cards that can be moved, such as Jira cards on a Kanban board. Combine with elevation.shadow.raised.

sunken.description: A secondary background for the UI commonly used for grouping items, such as Jira cards in columns.

perimeter.description: Use only when elevation.shadow.overflow is not technically feasible to implement. Pair with elevation.shadow.overflow.spread to replicate the overflow shadow.

spread.description: Use only when elevation.shadow.overflow is not technically feasible to implement. Pair with elevation.shadow.overflow.perimeter to replicate the overflow shadow.
